channel.title: Recursion on The Indian Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in Recursion on The Indian Engineer

item.title: Problem 1367 Linked List in Binary Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem Question Given a binary tree root and a linked list with head as the first node.

item.title: Problem 108 Convert Sorted Array to Binary Search Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 108 Question Given an integer array nums where the elements are sorted in ascending order, convert it to a height-balanced binary search tree.

item.title: Problem 1905 Count Sub Islands
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1905 Question You are given two m x n binary matrices grid1 and grid2 containing only 0's (representing water) and 1's (representing land).

item.title: Problem 226 Invert Binary Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 226 Question Given the root of a binary tree, invert the tree and return its root.

item.title: Problem 1382 Balance a Binary Search Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1382 Question Given the root of a binary search tree, return a balanced binary search tree with the same node values.

item.title: Problem 1038 Binary Search Tree to Greater Sum Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1038 Question Given the root of a Binary Search Tree (BST), convert it to a Greater Tree such that every key of the original BST is changed to the original key plus the sum of all keys greater than the original key in BST.

item.title: Problem 131 Palindrome Partitioning
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 131 Question Given a string s, partition s such that every substring of the partition is a palindrome.

item.title: Problem 78 Subsets
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 78 Question Given an integer array nums of unique elements, return all possible subsets (the power set).

item.title: Problem 1863 Sum of All Subset XOR Totals
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1863 Question The XOR total of an array is defined as the bitwise XOR of all its elements, or 0 if the array is empty.

item.title: Problem 979 Distribute Coins in Binary Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 979 Question You are given the root of a binary tree with n nodes where each node in the tree has node.

item.title: Problem 1325 Delete Leaves With a Given Value
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1325 Question Given a binary tree root and an integer target, delete all the leaf nodes with value target.
